name: 朱丽娅·罗克铁夫
awards: 2013年 第28届美国独立精神奖 最佳导演 (提名) 最孤独的星球
2012年 第22届哥谭独立电影奖 最佳影片 (提名) 最孤独的星球
2011年 第64届洛迦诺国际电影节 金豹奖 (提名) 最孤独的星球
name_full: 朱丽娅·罗克铁夫 Julia Loktev
birth_place: 苏联，列宁格勒（先俄罗斯圣彼得堡）

last_movies.title: 不受欢迎的朋友：第一部分 莫斯科的最后一息

introduction: Julia Loktev (born December 12, 1969) is a Russian-American film director and video artist. She was born in Leningrad, Soviet Union (now St. Petersburg, Russia).Loktev came across Tom Bishell's book of short stories God Lives in St. Petersburg and read it because she had been born in St. Petersburg. She decided to adapt the short story Expensive Trips Nowhere into the film The Loneliest Planet transporting the setting from Kazakhstan to Georgia.[3]Loktev was resident at Eyebeam in 2005.[4]In 2015, Richard Brody called her one of the best woman movie directors.
